issue.title: Create a way to visualize joint limits

content.raw:
Something to consider is using a GUI overlay object or a pop-up window instead of showing limits in the 3D world. For example, a window could list each joint (let you choose a joint) and then show the joint limits as numbers.

If you want something in the 3D space, it might be good to have the visual only appear when the user hovers over the joint's axis. Otherwise the screen may be too cluttered. You can put text in 3D space. For a revolute joint you could have an arc around the axis of rotation labeled with start and stop positions. A revolute joint with a rotation of > 360 could have the start and stop at the same location with appropriate labels.

There are quite a few joints to consider (such as a gear joints, universal, hinge2). The 2D pop-up window will be easier, but not as cool.
